entry.title: SAP Databricks: Building an Intelligent Enterprise with AI Unleashed – Part 3
entry.content:
Part 1 – SQL analytics with SAP Data Products
Part 2 – Build and deploy Mosaic AI and Agent Tools
Part 3 – Connect SAP Data Products with non-SAP data from AWS S3
Part 4 – End-to-end integration: SAP Databricks, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud
Part 5 – Create inferences and endpoints for application integration with SAP Build

SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud 

In today's data-driven world, gaining a 360-degree view of your enterprise requires combining data from all corners of your business. SAP systems house governed business data. Meanwhile, Amazon S3 often contains unstructured or external data—everything from web logs and partner data to machine learning features and fraud detection inputs.

Step-by-Step Playbook: Connecting AWS S3 to SAP Databricks

In this part of our blog series, we’ll walk you through connecting SAP Databricks to an Amazon S3 bucket — empowering you to unify data from diverse sources and accelerate your analytics and AI workflows.

By the end of this guide, you’ll have:

  • A Unity Catalog external location pointing to your S3 bucket
  • A registered table in Unity Catalog
  • A ready-to-run SAP Databricks notebook to analyze your unified data

We will be covering the following steps in this guide:

  • Step 1 – Create the External Location (AWS Quickstart)
  • Step 2 – Generate a Personal Access Token (PAT) in SAP Databricks
  • Step 3 – Identify (or create) the target S3 bucket
  • Step 4 – Configure the AWS IAM Role & Policies
  • Step 5 – Launch the AWS Quickstart CloudFormation Stack
  • Step 6 – Provide the PAT to the CloudFormation Stack
  • Step 7 – Verify CloudFormation Completion
  • Step 8 – Test the External Location connection in SAP Databricks
  • Step 9– Create a Unity Catalog table from the S3 data
  • Step 10 – Work with SAP Data Products and non-SAP data from S3 within the SAP Databricks Notebook environment 

Let's dive in.

Prerequisites

  • You must create the S3 bucket that you want to use as an external location before you create the external location object in SAP Databricks. More details documented here:
    • The AWS CloudFormation template supports only S3 buckets.
    • The name of an S3 bucket that you want users to read from and write to cannot use dot notation (for example, incorrect.bucket.name.notation). For more bucket naming guidance, see the AWS bucket naming rules.
    • Avoid using a path in S3 that is already defined as an external location in another Unity Catalog metastore. You can safely read data in a single external S3 location from more than one metastore, but concurrent writes to the same S3 location from multiple metastores can lead to consistency issues.
  • If you don't use the AWS CloudFormation template to create the external location, you must first create a storage credential in SAP Databricks that gives access to the cloud storage location path. See the following AWS doc: Create a storage credential.

If you use the AWS CloudFormation flow, that storage credential is created for you.

Permissions requirements

  • You must have the CREATE EXTERNAL LOCATION privilege on both the metastore and the storage credential referenced in the external location. Metastore admins have CREATE EXTERNAL LOCATION on the metastore by default.
  • If you are using the AWS CloudFormation template, you must also have the CREATE STORAGE CREDENTIAL privilege on the metastore. Metastore admins have CREATE STORAGE CREDENTIAL on the metastore by default.

This guide assumes you're using the SAP Databricks Quickstart on AWS, which automates much of the setup. Advanced users may opt for a manual setup with your IAM role (ARN), including the encryption algorithm of SSE-S3 or SSE-KMS.

Step 1 – Create the External Location

  • In SAP Databricks Unity Catalog, navigate to "Create an external location".
  • Use the Quickstart wizard to create your external location.
  • Alternatively, advanced users can manually configure an AWS IAM Role and specify the S3 bucket path.

Step 2 – Generate a Personal Access Token (PAT)

  • In SAP Databricks, generate a PAT that will be used during the AWS CloudFormation setup.

Step 3 – Identify Your S3 Bucket

  • Meanwhile, choose or create the S3 bucket that holds your non-SAP data.
  • Example: Fraud detection data (AWS sample data).

Step 4 – Configure Your AWS IAM Role & Policies

Ensure the IAM role used by SAP Databricks has the following permissions to enable secure and functional access to your AWS data environment:

  • AmazonS3FullAccess
    Grants full access to all Amazon S3 buckets and objects within the account.
    Used to read/write data from S3, list buckets, and manage objects.
  • AmazonS3TablesFullAccess
    Grants access to AWS Glue tables and data lake metadata.
    Supports Unity Catalog integration with external tables stored in S3.
  • AmazonS3ObjectLambdaExecutionRolePolicy
    Enables the role to invoke AWS Lambda functions when accessing S3 objects.
    Required only if using S3 Object Lambda to dynamically transform or filter data before it is consumed by Databricks.
  • IAMFullAccess
    Grants full access to manage IAM resources such as roles, policies, users, and groups.
    Recommended only for administrative or automated setup environments (e.g., CloudFormation). For production, follow the principle of least privilege and only allow specific IAM actions such as iam:PassRole or iam:AssumeRole.

Step 5 – Launch the AWS Quickstart CloudFormation Stack

  • Launch the Quickstart template from within SAP Databricks, and it will direct you to the AWS Quickstart CloudFormation Stack.
  • Note the Personal Access Token (PAT) as you'll be prompted to input it in AWS.

Step 6 – Provide Your Personal Access Token to the Stack

  • Input the PAT generated in the previous step to allow SAP Databricks access.

Step 7 – Verify Stack Completion

  • Monitor the CloudFormation Stack – the status will change from CREATE_IN_PROGRESS to CREATE_COMPLETE.

Step 8 – Test the External Location Connection

  • In SAP Databricks, return to your external location under Catalog Explorer and click “Test Connection”.
  • Verify external location and credential permissions for Read, Write, and more.

Step 9 – Create a Unity Catalog Table from S3 Data

  • Select a file in your S3 bucket and register it as a table in Unity Catalog.
  • Navigate to Unity Catalog to confirm your new table appears and is accessible for querying

Step 10 – Work with SAP Data Products and non-SAP S3 Data within the Notebook environment

  • Use the SAP Databricks notebook environment to run analyses on your newly unified data.
  • You can join SAP Data Products with external S3 data for richer insights, all within the same environment.
  • For basic visualizations, harness the power of the notebook environment. For comprehensive dashboarding, SAP Analytics Cloud—part of the SAP Business Data Cloud—offers pre-built templates, robust architecture, and seamless integration with enterprise data, enabling scalable and insightful analytics.

By connecting AWS S3 to SAP Databricks, you can seamlessly unify external and SAP business data for more powerful analytics and AI workflows. This integration enables easy access, management, and analysis of diverse datasets within SAP Business Data Cloud. 

In the next part, we will explore end-to-end integration between SAP Databricks, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud, completing the unified analytics journey from data ingestion to actionable insights.

entry.title: Re: Push notifications using SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi Vladyslav,

Thanks for your detailed message! I totally understand the confusion around SAP BTP Mobile Services and the APK build process.

Why the Mobile Services are required:

When your app uses SAP BTP Connectivity features (like authentication, push notifications, or backend integration through Mobile Services), the build and runtime processes require Mobile Services to be enabled. This is because the app depends on the Mobile Services infrastructure to handle these features securely and correctly.

Why you can’t disable Mobile Services for your current app:

If your app is configured to use Mobile Services (for example, via the SAP Mobile Services SDK or in your app descriptor), the build tools expect Mobile Services to be enabled.

The Preview App and the APK build process enforce these checks to prevent runtime errors or misconfigurations.

Hence, even when building an empty app or trying to get an APK without Mobile Services enabled, the system detects the app settings and stops the build.

How to build an APK without Mobile Services:

The simplest way is to create a new app project without enabling Mobile Services integration. Make sure your app descriptor (manifest) and any connectivity configurations do not include Mobile Services or related plugins.

Alternatively, you can remove any Mobile Services-related configuration from your existing app and its build settings, but this can be tedious if the app already relies on those features.

Summary:

Mobile Services need to be enabled if your app uses its features.

You cannot download an APK without enabling Mobile Services if your app depends on them.

To avoid this, start with a project that does not include Mobile Services from the beginning.

Hope this helps clear things up! Feel free to share your project details if you want me to help check the exact configuration.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Whitescreen after logging in Public cloud with Zebra...
entry.content:
Hello @Nihit 

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. The issue appears to be a compatibility challenge between your Zebra scanner and the SAP Enterprise Browser. Since the scanner works well in Google Chrome, it suggests that the Enterprise Browser may have limitations in handling the scanner's input events.

Verify Zebra Scanner Configuration:

  • Ensure the scanner is set to HID Keyboard Emulation mode for broader compatibility.
  • Avoid Serial/COM or USB CDC modes, as they may not be supported by the Enterprise Browser.

Review SAP Enterprise Browser Permissions:

  • Check for input restrictions in kiosk mode or other settings that may block keyboard inputs.
  • Access the Admin Console to review input device support and configuration settings.

Test Across Browsers:

  • Test the scanner in other Chromium-based browsers like Microsoft Edge to determine if the issue is specific to the SAP wrapper.

Update Zebra Firmware and Drivers:

    • Ensure the scanner’s firmware and drivers are up to date.
    • Consider using Zebra’s SDK for enhanced integration.

Escalation and Support:

    • If issues persist, submit a support ticket with SAP for Enterprise Browser-specific help.
    • Contact Zebra Technical Support for further assistance with compatibility.

Reference

  • Zebra Enterprise Browser Setup
  • Zebra Scanner Configuration Guide
  • Zebra Scanner SDK and Developer Resources
  • SAP Notes on Peripheral Device Integration (search for scanner integration notes)

Let me know if it helps

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: we need to deactived the ForTrade/Customs label which...
entry.content: In SPRO navigate to Sales & Distribution → Foreign Trade/Customs → Control foreign trade data in MM and SD documents → Foreign trade data in MM & SD documents. In the resulting table, delete any entries that match your billing doc types (or sales areas) so that no combination remains “foreign‐trade relevant.” Save your change. Once there are no entries for your billing document type, SAP stops requiring or displaying the “Number of Foreign‐Trade Data” field in the header.

entry.title: Re: Transformation Flow partition generation with SAP Datasphere CLI
entry.content:
Hi @Sefan_Linders ,

with wave 2025.16 transformation flows can be processed in batches in case of the HANA runtime to avoid Out-Of-Memory (OOM) errors, see https://help.sap.com/whats-new/48017b2cc4834fc6b6cae87097bd9e4d?locale=en-US&Version=2025.16&Category=Data+Integration and https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/be5967d099974c69b77f4549425ca4c0/b661ea0766a24c7d839df950330a89fd.html?locale=en-US.
Processing a transformation flow works without splitting the transformation flow into multiple transformation flows. Furthermore batches are created dynamically at runtime. That means once additional values occurs for the column used to define the batches, the definition of the ranges defining the batches is adjusted automatically and additional batches may be created.

Can you mention in your blog that processing in batches can/should be used instead of what is described in the blog?


A big thank you for providing this blog as it helped to solve many Out-Of-Memory (OOM) errors as long as processing in batch hasn't been available.

Best regards,

Michael

entry.title: Re: RAP odata v4 service modify items entities managed save
entry.content:
Hi @Filo 

Hi Filippo,

Thank you for your detailed explanation and screenshots.

To ensure the materials selected in the MultiInput field are properly sent to the backend, I recommend binding the selected values directly to the model used by your items table (ZC_SD_MILESTONES).

Below are steps I suggest:

  • Bind the MultiInput value or tokens to a model path for example “Materials” and using a formatter to convert tokens to a string or array.
  • Update the model with the selected materials after the selection dialog using oModel.setProperty
  • Ensure a two-way binding is enabled or refreshing (true) the model explicitly.
  • Include the updated values in your batch submission to persist them.
  • Alternatively, you can use a custom formatter to serialize/deserialize the material tokens from and to your model’s string representation.

This will allow your selected materials to be captured correctly and included in the backend update.

Please note that you should avoid direct manipulation of UI control values. Always go through the model. Also, consider creating a JSON structure inside the model to help you map milestone-to-material selections if complex logic is needed.

 

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Guidance Required: Loading Freight and GST on Freight...
entry.content:
In the SAP Note’s STO billing-procedure example, freight is treated as a “service” on the delivery header, so the delivered procedure uses PB00 to capture that base amount.

SAP’s delivered STO example does not generate any material‐price lines (the goods transfer has no “gross price”). Instead they copy a service pricing procedure (one starting with PB00). PB00 captures the “base freight charge” on the delivery header. The next condition (e.g. ZFRE or delivered tax type) calculates GST on PB00. This aligns with OBYC. OBYC key GBB (Freight accrual) is pre-wired to PB00–service keys. You can define your own ZFR1 for freight base and ZFRE for GST on freight and assign them to your STO procedure in M/08. Just be sure to give your base-freight condition the same accrual-key (GBB) in OBYC. Position your tax-on-freight condition immediately afterward

entry.title: Re: Back dated termination process in Offboarding
entry.content:
Hi @GauravKhandelwal 

For death related separation event reasons mostly the separation will be executed by People leader or System Admin or HR Operations team. 

This scenario can be handled by two days, 

Approach 1. You can create business rule based on Role based permission to allow back dated termination for death related termination event reason.

Approach 2. You can enable RBP for death relation event reasons only to People leader or System Admin or HR Operations team and in the business rule you shall define that death related termination is before today or less than some defined months, allow the screen to submit the request.

Thanks

Arun

entry.title: Re: Unable to see list data when I run the app
entry.content:
Hello @Ankita_Mundhra 

Thank you again for sharing the screenshot.

The issue you're facing with the repeated list not displaying as expected is most likely due to the way the data variable is being referenced in the Repeat with field.

From your screenshot, the expression used is:

Repeat with: data.myrecordList.records

This structure assumes that the data variable myrecordList returns an object containing a property called records (e.g., { records: [...] }). However, if your data source returns a flat array like:

[
{ "name": "...", "deliveryStatus": "...", "warehouseLocation": "..." },
...
]

then the correct binding should be:

Repeat with: data.myrecordList

Using .records in this case will result in an undefined binding, and the list will not render.
Recommended Steps:

Add a temporary text component with:

JSON.stringify(data.myrecordList)

to inspect the actual structure being returned.

Based on the output:

  • If you see an array, remove.records from the repeat expression.
  • If it is nested under records, the original expression is fine.

Also ensure the list is set to autoload or triggered via logic flow, and that individual fields (like name, delivery status) are correctly mapped to existing properties.

Check below reference

https://help.sap.com/docs/build-apps/service-guide/build-and-deploy-web-applications?q=Working+with+Lists

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Leveraging SAP S/4HANA for Tank Planning and -Scheduling
entry.content:
Hi Thiago,

even though the focus for tank planning is for process industry scenarios, the underlying constraint modeling with the container resource (resource with storage characteristics) also applies for discrete / repetitive scenarios. E.g. if you have a storage constraints between component production and assembly lines (limited storage buffer)  you can also use this model. So the combination of using routings with product storage definitions is supported.

However the modeling capabilities with recipes for complex material flow definitions with flexible operation relationship definitions etc... are stronger than with discrete routings.

Please also check  the restriction note for tank planning which provides more details / recommendations on the topic: https://me.sap.com/notes/3352543/E

Best regards,
Uli

entry.title: Re: convert and xml in xsd for an odataservice for a purc...
entry.content:
Hi @marco_sposa 

Thanks for sharing your XSD snippet and describing the binding challenges.

From experience and official SAP Adobe Forms guidelines, here are key points to check for successful binding of nested nodes:

  • Ensure that repeating nodes like SupplierNode have both minOccurs="0" and maxOccurs="unbounded" in the XSD to correctly represent collections.
  • Verify that your Adobe Form field bindings match the full XPath, including all parent elements, for example PurchaseOrders/PurchaseOrderNode/Suppliers/SupplierNode.
  • Check the runtime XML data instance against your XSD to confirm structure and naming consistency.
  • Look out for namespace mismatches if namespaces are involved.

Most Adobe Forms binding issues with nested elements arise from incomplete or incorrect XPath binding or missing maxOccurs settings on repeating nodes.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: How to perform lease liabilities reclass from REFX mo...
entry.content:
Hello @charlene2 ,

Thank you for your question.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the transaction OBJREG (used in on-premise systems to reclassify lease liabilities) is not available, as SAP GUI transactions are not supported in the cloud environment.

How to perform lease liability reclassification in Public Cloud:

In the cloud, reclassification is handled automatically as part of the lease valuation process using Fiori apps:

Schedule Real Estate Valuation Runs
Use this app to execute lease valuations, which include liability reclassification, interest, and discounting.

Post Valuation Results
This app posts the relevant accounting documents, including journal entries for short-term and long-term lease liability reclassifications based on lease terms and key dates.

Prerequisites:

  • Ensure valuation parameters and accounting rules are properly configured (e.g., valuation methods, interest rates, reclassification logic).
  • This process supports compliance with IFRS 16 / ASC 842 and is included in scope item 55_5 – Lease-in Accounting (RE-FX).

SAP Help – Real Estate Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Real Estate Management-SAP Help 

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Enterprise Architect Summit - Berlin 2025: Transforming Enterprises. Architecting the Future
entry.content:
Enterprise Architects are evolving — from being seen as systems experts and sometimes technology gatekeepers to strategic influencers, change leaders, and orchestrators of innovation. The SAP Enterprise Architect Summit 2025 in Berlin recognizes this shift and we have designed the contents and themes to empower the Enterprise Architecture community members to lead with clarity, creativity, and conviction.

We are meeting up at the beautiful SAP Berlin Office (BER01)  with transformation leaders, seasoned architects, SAP experts, and innovation partners to come together to have sessions across 8 multi-dimensional themes this year, each exploring the expanding role of the architect.

These aren’t siloed topics — they’re interconnected lenses into how architecture drives change at scale:

  1. AI + Architect– Exploring the responsible, scalable application of AI through the EA lens with actionable use cases that drive business value.
  2. Enterprise Data Intelligence– Building flexible, semantically rich data landscapes that businesses can rely on!
  3. Industry-Ready Architectures – Leveraging SAP Industry Kits and SAP Architecture content to accelerate delivery and time to value.
  4. Operating Models for a Robust EA Practice– Scaling EA practice through governance, tooling, and engagement - here’s to building new EA operating models.

entry.title: Re: Standard API consume in Custom App Job
entry.content:
Hi @Abhishek2785 

Thank you for your question.

Please note that the SAP standard API BankStatementPost_In cannot directly ingest MT940 files.

The correct approach is:

  1. To parse the MT940 file within your custom application to extract all transaction and statement data.
  2. Then, map the parsed data to the BankStatementPost_In API payload format (including the required header and line items).
  3. Finally, POST the structured payload (SOAP) to the API through your custom job.

Please note that direct upload or ingestion of bank statement files in formats such as MT940 is not supported by the API, as confirmed in the official SAP documentation.

For full specifications, please refer to the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud documentation for BankStatementPost_In.

Bank Statement - Post

Need Bank API details-S4HANA CLoud

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY_CDS - "Expression.Error: Access to the resource is forbidden"
entry.content:
Hello,

We're trying to connect the CDS view C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY with Power BI using the OData feed.

Although this CDS view works correctly in the browser via the browser application, it fails when connecting through Power BI, with the following error: "Expression.Error: Access to the resource is forbidden".

Upon analysis, we observed that this CDS view is not part of any active communication scenario in the system. We have the following queries:

  1. Is there a recommended standard communication scenario that includes C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY as an inbound OData service?

  2. If not, can SAP include this service in one of the standard supported scenarios?

We've searched in the API Hub with C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY, but could not find a standard API related to it.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY_CDS - "Expression.Error: A...
entry.content:
Hello,

The root cause of the issue, is that C_SalesVolumeAnalysisQuery is an analytical query, which exposes not OData but protocol. It cannot be used directly by the external system.

You can consider the below three options:

  • Option 1:
    Expose a Custom CDS View as External API（using I_BillingDocumentItemCube as the data source).
    For more details, you can refer to:
    Help Portal: Exposing a Custom CDS View as External API
    and
    Community blog: Create CDS views in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and consume them as APIs

  • Option 2:
    Use Billing Document Related OData API (from the SAP API Hub).

  • Option 3:
    Use OData exposed via CDS Data Extraction:
    C_BillingDocItemBasicDEX_1
    C_BillgDocItmPrcgElmntBscDEX_1
    I_BillingDocumentItem
    I_BillingDocument
    For more details, you can refer to Help Portal: Integrating CDI.

entry.title: Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution.  

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

 

In this blog post I’d like to outline the innovations for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 in the area of Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management. These are the topics that are covered:

  • Efficient project plan scheduling: Calculate dates for project structure elements in a project plan (6JN)
  • Embedding content in SAP Project and Resource Management (6JN)
  • Monitoring and comprehensive insights with project financial booklets (1NT) 
  • Creation of WBS elements across company codes for revenue projects (1NT) 
  • Create billing plan dates from project milestones​ (1NT) 
  • Further innovations

 

Check out my video to get a glimpse of the new features:

 

 

In the dynamic world of business, the ability to efficiently manage portfolios and projects is a crucial determinant of success. It's here that SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, steps in as a transformative solution, offering a comprehensive suite of innovations designed to help businesses streamline operations, enhance financial insight, and foster collaboration. This blog post delves into these groundbreaking innovations, emphasizing their business value and how they empower end-users to achieve unparalleled efficiency and effectiveness.

Enhancements in SAP Project and Resource Management

Efficient project plan scheduling: Calculate dates for project structure elements in a project plan

At the core of successful project management is the ability to schedule and manage timelines effectively. The latest release introduces new scheduling capabilities such as backward and bottom-up scheduling within SAP Project and Resource Management. For project managers, this enhanced scheduling functionalities ensure precise timeline predictions, they reduce project delays and pave the way for timely completions. By automating scheduling, project managers can focus on strategic tasks, improving overall project efficiency. As a nice side effect, more reliable schedules, conflicts and resource contention are minimized.

You can also find more information in the blog post provided by my colleague Ellen Reuther.

 

Figure 1: Enhanced scheduling functionalities such as backward and bottom-up scheduling optimizes project planning. 

 

Embedding content in SAP Project and Resource Management

Moreover, embedded content in SAP Project and Resource Management offers significant efficiency boost for project management through customization.

You can integrate custom dashboards directly into SAP to display essential KPIs seamlessly, enhancing focus and reducing the need to switch applications. You can also modify project management interfaces as business needs evolve, ensuring continuous alignment with objectives. Embedded content remains fully functional post-system upgrades, minimizing technical disruptions and preserving focus on core tasks.

You can also find more information in the help.

 

Figure 2: Flexible extension capabilities allow for seamless integration of custom content directly within SAP applications.

 

Enhancements in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Monitoring and comprehensive insights with project financial booklets

The new application “Project Financial Booklet – Enterprise Projects” is designed for project controllers and accountants, offering insights into project profitability through multidimensional analysis. This application provides three pivotal views, each delivering a granular perspective on financial health:

  • Project margin overview
  • Project billing element view
  • Project budget availability control (AVC),

 

This enables you to conduct deep profitability analyses, allowing you to quickly identify and act on top-performing projects. The flexibility of its filtering and customization options ensures that you can tailor reports to align with specific business objectives, thereby enhancing decision-making accuracy.

Figure 3: Leveraging conditional formatting as part of the project budget AVC view brings any alerts immediately to your attention.

 

Moreover, the innovation's real-time conditional formatting acts as a proactive alert system, helping you to stay ahead of potential financial risks by highlighting critical figures like budget utilization. Its seamless integration with other applications promotes efficient navigation and a holistic perspective on the project environment. By fostering early trend detection and anomaly recognition, this tool enables project managers to make informed, strategic decisions, thereby reducing financial risks and improving resource allocation. Overall, the booklet empowers businesses to drive efficiency, optimize budget management, and ultimately enhance profitability, making it a pivotal advancement in project financial oversight. Currently, this functionality is available for sales accountants only, but it’s planned to be available for project financial controllers with the future release.

 

Figure 4: Explore the different views as part of the new project financial booklet ensuring efficient project analysis.

 

Creation of WBS elements across company codes for revenue projects

With SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, we allow users to create Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) elements that span multiple company codes specifically for revenue projects. This capability was previously available for overhead, statistical, and investment projects, but is now extended to revenue projects.

A significant feature is that within a single billing hierarchy of a project, only one company code is maintained, ensuring that profitability can be viewed in the local currency of the company code. If an overarching view of the project’s profitability is desired, it can be evaluated in a global currency or project currency. In practical terms, this allows for the execution of a single revenue project using multiple legal entities, enhancing the flexibility and complexity with which projects can be managed and structured across different geographical areas or business units.

The system includes validations to ensure compliance, such as ensuring that a single billing hierarchy isn't assigned multiple company codes. This feature supports API capability, meaning that project creation and management can also be done through external systems, maintaining the integrity of this multi-company code structure. These enhancements help streamline project execution and profitability analysis across diverse company codes in global organizations. 

 

Figure 5: The creation of WBS elements across company codes is enabled for revenue projects.

 

Create billing plan dates from project milestones

This innovation aims to improve synchronization between project management and billing processes. It allows users to integrate project milestones directly with sales order billing plans, creating a seamless connection between project progress and billing schedules. By doing so, it ensures that billing can be triggered automatically upon milestone completion, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in financial transactions.

Project managers and finance teams can get real-time visibility into billing and revenue forecasts based on project status. Furthermore, manual interventions and potential errors related to billing alignments are reduced. The feature is designed to support revenue recognition processes by aligning project deliverables with contractual billing terms, thereby optimizing cash flow management. Overall, this innovation is part of a broader effort to streamline enterprise project management within the SAP ecosystem, ensuring tight integration across corporate functions.

 

Figure 6: Execute revenue projects via multiple legal entities: Create billing plan items based on project milestones.  

 

Further innovations

Extending project control – Enterprise projects application

With the “Project Control – Enterprise Projects” application you can now enable SAP UI5 adaptation. This enhancement allows for the creation of application variants via the SAPUI adaptation project, granting flexibility without altering the original source.

Changes made are reflected in artifacts representing only the updates, not the entire application, and are handled within the SAP Business Application Studio. This ensures that the modifications are seamless, maintaining the integrity and performance of the original application. For further information, please refer to Extending SAP Fiori Applications | SAP Help Portal

Use extended situation handling for enterprise projects

We have enhanced the situation handling framework by allowing self-modeled situation templates within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud environment. This feature aims to address operational inefficiencies and errors that result from manual oversight in enterprise project execution phases. By enabling key users to create custom situation use cases that align with specific business scenarios, the system helps to proactively mitigate risks such as delays and demand fluctuations. Read more in this blog post by my colleague Mark Huang.


Deprecation of resource-related intercompany billing

With SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 we have deprecated the traditional resource-related intercompany billing and are introducing a successor model that offers greater flexibility and transparency.

This new approach is easily activated through configuration settings and allows continued use of existing applications and records during transition. The new model aims to streamline processes and improve financial visibility, although existing records can still be managed and used with the upgraded system. Find out how to activate the new resource-related intercompany billing here.

 

 

Figure 6: Execute revenue projects via multiple legal entities: Create billing plan items based on project milestones.  

 

Further innovations

Extending project control – Enterprise projects application

With the “Project Control – Enterprise Projects” application you can now enable SAP UI5 adaptation. This enhancement allows for the creation of application variants via the SAPUI adaptation project, granting flexibility without altering the original source.

Changes made are reflected in artifacts representing only the updates, not the entire application, and are handled within the SAP Business Application Studio. This ensures that the modifications are seamless, maintaining the integrity and performance of the original application. For further information, please refer to Extending SAP Fiori Applications | SAP Help Portal

Use extended situation handling for enterprise projects

We have enhanced the situation handling framework by allowing self-modeled situation templates within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud environment. This feature aims to address operational inefficiencies and errors that result from manual oversight in enterprise project execution phases. By enabling key users to create custom situation use cases that align with specific business scenarios, the system helps to proactively mitigate risks such as delays and demand fluctuations. Read more in this blog post by my colleague Mark Huang.


SAP Project and Resource Management enhancements

Resource managers now have the ability to set request data as fulfilled, which aids in bookkeeping by marking resource requests as completed. More insights into resource management, especially focusing on the staffing of the right employees can be found in the Miguel von Rotz’s blog post.

Moreover, we’ve enhanced project management capabilities via increased API coverage for issue management and project planning, along with predefined custom fields for issue objects. Last but not least, we have made some integration improvements to further streamline processing statuses for projects, ultimately enhancing the overall management capabilities.

If you want to find out more about streamlined collaboration in ETO projects, you can also refer to the blog post published by my colleague Renato Zadro.

 

More Information

If you are interested in the latest and greatest blog posts on Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management, please have a look at my collection blog and also take a look at the Community page for Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management (Project Control).

 

📽Watch the Replays of Our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 Early Release Series!   

From July 21 to July 25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management as well as 20 other topics of interest. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand – anywhere, anytime.

entry.title: Re: Can't find archived documents in external repository...
entry.content:
Hello @tibrue 

Thank you for raising this important topic regarding SAP document archiving with CMIS and the challenge of missing business object metadata.

Currently, SAP’s CMIS interface archives documents as general cmis:document objects, which is identified by ArchiveDocumentId without exposing detailed business object attributes like purchase order number to external DMS solutions. This makes business-contextual search and filtering in external repositories difficult, resulting in what you described as a large undifferentiated document pool.

The official SAP standard does not yet provide functionality to include the business object entity name and primary keys with archived documents via CMIS out-of-the-box. This limitation is recognized in the SAP community and environment.

To address this, companies often implement custom middleware or leverage third-party archiving products (e.g., easy archive solutions) that enrich archived documents with SAP business metadata, which allows them to achieve enhanced search capabilities externally.

Your idea to include business object entity information and keys alongside ArchiveDocumentId in the CMIS payloads is highly relevant and aligns with the needs of enterprise users aiming for greater integration and findability.

Engaging with SAP through influence channels (SAP Community, SAP Customer Engagement Initiatives) to request enhanced metadata support in CMIS archiving for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud could accelerate delivery of such features.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: how to repeat table in adobe form's masterpage?
entry.content:
@F1592

I have raised this with SAP last year and they suggested to follow the instructions in sap note 3236812. 

However the example that they showed me while discussing did not work with the live data that are generated in my SFP interface. The keyword mergeMode="matchTemplate" in SFP's XML layout tab will go missing every time i activate my form in SFP. 

I found a workaround by adding that keyword mergeMode="matchTemplate" in the .XDP file via notepad, go into SFP and don't click on the 'Layout' tab, then upload the .XDP file as layout and activate it. This workaround will not erase that keyword and i can repeat the table on every page. You may need to repeat this step every time you make changes and re-activate.

SAP mentioned that this is a bug with Adobe Livecycle and it is being tracked internally by Adobe with Jira ID LC-3922506. There has been no update since.

Sorry it has been a year so i am trying my best to reply based on the chat history.

entry.title: Re: Integration of SAP Cloud ALM with Nobl9 Observability...
entry.content:
Hi @JoCoutinho 

Thank you for your detailed overview.

Please note that Nobl9 currently cannot directly consume SAP Cloud ALM API data. The recommended approach is to use Grafana Alloy (OpenTelemetry Collector) as an integration bridge: SAP Cloud ALM data flows into Grafana, then Alloy forwards the collected metrics to Nobl9 for SLO management.

Using the SAP ALM Plugin for Grafana alone is insufficient, as it does not enable Nobl9 ingestion.

Alternatively, since your SAP BTP-IS Advanced Event Mesh includes Datadog, you may leverage this existing Datadog setup to feed Nobl9, provided it includes the SAP Cloud ALM metrics you require. This can avoid additional licensing or infrastructure.

I recommend prototyping the Grafana Alloy approach or validating the Datadog coverage to identify the best integration path. 

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Integrate SAP Customer Checkout Mobile Orders with a...
entry.content:
Hello @Fedias 

Thank you for your question regarding the integration of SAP Customer Checkout (CCO) Mobile Orders with a local bank for payment processing.

At present, SAP CCO does not natively support direct integration with local banks. Payment processing in CCO is typically handled through certified payment service providers (PSPs) using standard plugins or APIs. SAP provides integration support for several PSPs, such as SIX, Worldline, and BS PAYONE, which can act as intermediaries to your local bank if supported.

SAP Recommended Approach:

  • Check if your local bank partners with a PSP that already has a certified integration with SAP CCO.
  • If no PSP is available, integration may require a custom middleware solution to bridge SAP CCO Mobile Orders with the bank’s payment API.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_CUSTOMER_CHECKOUT/e5d9932f72cc4556b2e982905511b717/a08f574dbf6242dc8dd95708560117a1.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_CUSTOMER_CHECKOUT/b3ef5bb1234b4776bc5f19afbc601405/fccc2c077a33416e8820d8caad8240d5.html


Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Example code for SAP_COM_0466 - Print Queue Item - Read (A2X)
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog focuses on how to get documents out from the SAP Print Queue and how to pass them on to an external Output Management System (OMS) for processing and printing using the SAP provided API. It supplements the already existing blog with example implementation with JAVA code of  SAP_COM_0466 - Print Queue Item - Read (A2X).

Example code for SAP_COM_0466 - Print Queue Item - Read (A2X)

See the details on SAP_COM_0466 | SAP Help Portal how to configure your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system to support Print Queues. 
Prerequisites: 

  • Compiled with SAPMachine 21. You can download here.
  • Download (e.g. here) and add latest version of class org.json 
  • Adapt with your personal connection and access details.  

Please note that code is meant as example how the api can be used. Code is not claimed to be complete, to be error free or to be state of the art programming style. 

Usage of the example code

  1. Download (e.g. here) and add latest version of class org.json 
  2. Adopt cope with your access details
  3. Compile code (I used SAPMachine 21).
  4. Run code
  5. Create a document on the configured print queue in SAP System
  6. Code will  process print queue item
  7. You can also simulate errors on the print queue item. See comments in the code

Remind!
Code is meant as example how the api can be used. Code is not claimed to be complete, to be error free or to be state of the art programming style. Nevertheless feedback is welcome.

import java.net.CookieManager;
import java.net.http.*;
import java.net.URI;
import java.util.Base64;
import java.util.concurrent.*; 
import org.json.*;

class SAP_COM_0466_example {
    
    public static int Get_System_Details(  System_Str[] System_Details ) throws Exception {
    // get details of the SAP sytem for api and other calls
    
        // pre-defined system details and credentials for testing, needs to be configured in SAP system beforehand

    public static int Get_Bearer_Token( StringBuilder BearerToken, String Credentials, System_Str System_Details ) throws Exception {
    // For BTP only to get the bearer token for oauth authentication 

        String       UrlLocator;                                                                               // http request url
        HttpRequest  RequestBody;                                                                              // http request body
        HttpHeaders  RequestHeaders;                                                                           // http request header
        HttpResponse ResponseReply;                                                                            // http reply body
        HttpHeaders  ResponseHeaders;                                                                          // http reply header
        String       ResponseCodeL;                                                                            // http response code
        String       BearerTokenL;                                                                             // BTP bearer token for oauth authentication
        
        UrlLocator = System_Details.SystemUrl.substring(System_Details.SystemUrl.indexOf("api.") + 4);         // extract location of BTP account
        UrlLocator = UrlLocator.substring(0,UrlLocator.indexOf("."));                                 
        UrlLocator = "https://" + System_Details.SubDomain + ".authentication." + UrlLocator + ".hana.ondemand.com"; // build url for bearer token request
        //System.out.println(UrlLocator + "/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials");              
                                                                                                      
        RequestBody = HttpRequest.newBuilder()                                                                 // build the http request
        .uri(URI.create( UrlLocator + "/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials"))                           // add path for bearer token request
        .version(HttpClient.Version.HTTP_2)                                                                    // set call context
        .header("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
        .header("accept", "application/xml")
        .header("user-agent", "printqueuequery")
        .header("Authorization", Credentials)
        .method("GET", HttpRequest.BodyPublishers.noBody())
        .build();

        RequestHeaders  = RequestBody.headers();                                                               // read the request header for error analysis 
        ResponseReply   = HttpClient.newHttpClient().send(RequestBody, HttpResponse.BodyHandlers.ofString());  // initiate http call
        ResponseHeaders = ResponseReply.headers();                                                             // read the reply header for error analysis    
        ResponseCodeL   = ResponseReply.toString();                                                            
        ResponseCodeL   = ResponseCodeL.substring(ResponseCodeL.length()-3,ResponseCodeL.length());            // extract http status code

        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("Get_Bearer_Token");
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("HttpRequest");    
        //System.out.println(RequestBody);        
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("RequestHeaders");
        //System.out.println(RequestHeaders);
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("ResponseReply");    
        //System.out.println(ResponseReply);    
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("ResponseBody");    
        //System.out.println(ResponseReply.body());    
        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("ResponseHeaders");
        //System.out.println(ResponseHeaders);
        //System.out.println("");        
        //System.out.println("BearerToken: \"" + BearerTokenL + "\"");        
        //System.out.println("");
                    
        BearerTokenL    = ResponseReply.body().toString();                                                     // extract bearer token from http reply
        if ( BearerTokenL.contains("\"access_token\":\"") )                                                    // check if bearer token is in http reply
        {
            BearerTokenL    = BearerTokenL.substring(BearerTokenL.indexOf("\"access_token\":\"")+16);          // extract bearer token
            BearerTokenL    = BearerTokenL.substring(0,BearerTokenL.indexOf("\","));
        }
        else {
            BearerTokenL    = "";
            System.out.println("    BearerToken missing in http-reply");                                       // show error message if bearer token is missing
        }

        BearerToken.setLength(0);                                                                              // return the bearer token
        BearerToken.append(BearerTokenL);
        
        return (Integer.valueOf(ResponseCodeL));                                                               // return the http status code
    }

        ResponseCodeL   = ResponseCodeL.substring(ResponseCodeL.length()-3,ResponseCodeL.length());            // extract http status code
        
        //System.out.println("");

        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("ResponseHeaders");
        //System.out.println(ResponseHeaders);
        //System.out.println("");
    
        ICMCacheL = "";                                                                                        // extract the SAP ICM cache status from http reply
        if ( ResponseReply.body().toString().length() > 99 ) {                                                 // check if SAP ICM cache status is in  http reply
            if ( !ResponseReply.body().toString().contains("{\"d\":{") ) {                                     // check if proper structure is received
				System.out.println("error occured");                                                           // exit in case of elemd "d" does not exist
				System.out.println(ResponseReply.body());

        ICMcache.setLength(0);                                                                                 // return the SAP ICM cache status
        ICMcache.append(ICMCacheL);

        return (Integer.valueOf(ResponseCodeL));                                                               // return the http status code
    }

        //System.out.println("");
        //System.out.println("ResponseHeaders");
        //System.out.println(ResponseHeaders);
        //System.out.println("");        
        
        Qname_NoL = 0;                                                                                         // initiate the number of Print Queues
        if ( ResponseCodeL.equals("200") && (ResponseReply.body().toString().length() > 99) ) {               // check if there is payload
            if ( !ResponseReply.body().toString().contains("{\"d\":{") ) {                                     // check if proper structure is received
				System.out.println("error occured");                                                           // exit in case of elemd "d" does not exist

            }
        }
        Qname_No[0] = Qname_NoL;                                                                               // return the number of Print Queues 
        
        return (Integer.valueOf(ResponseCodeL));                                                               // return the http status code
    }
